title: Apdo's smurf account compared to others
body:
So I got linked the OP.GG profile of Apdo's new smurf account.

For those that dont know he is known as a solo queue god because of his insane win rates and high performances. Here is what you are not being told and shown.

I manually input all of this info of every single random teammate in each ranked solo game over 3 different accounts. I compared the random teammates of Apdo's games to the randoms that I had in my own games and averaged the total kda of every random that each account played with.

Here is the spreadsheet I whipped up: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1iIK7KBC1wM0qL24zMxIcZ1-hxfHwMtrV7b9ltgbfy9g/edit?usp=sharing
Feel free to check my work

As you can see, the random teammates that Apdo was given on average performed pretty damn well, I do not believe Apdo played support in any one of these games, so 1/4 of his teammates played as support, which usually have low kills medium deaths and high assists, which would lower the average Kills to deaths ratio. Despite this disadvantage of his teammates KDA potential being lower due to supports usual kda ratio, all of his teammates pulled out on average, 36% more kills than they had deaths.

With these teammates he achieved a 100% winrate over 45 games. Despite not performing in every game he still won them all.

I made my own smurf account to test out whether or not a different account puts you on the better team more often. With only having played the 10 placement game so far, the average kda of my teammates was only 5% more kills than deaths. I ended up with a 70% win rate.

On my main account however, in my ranked solo games I only ended up with a 44% win rate over 52 games despite a positive kda on average.

Sure enough, when I averaged up all of the KDA of each random teammate, they had 18% more deaths on average than they had kills.

On both my accounts I have almost **the same KDA**, one with a 70% win rate, and one with a 44% win rate.

No personal scores were apart of the teammates KDA.

The end result is Apdo's account was given 36% better teammates than the average and managed to achieve a 100% winrate.
The whitepuma account was given 5% better teammates than the average and managed to achieve a 70% winrate.
The whitepumah account was given 18% worse teammates than the average and only achieved a 44% winrate.

I understand that KDA does not equal the result of each game, but based on these statistics, it paints a pretty clear picture as to how KDA of 80% of the team directly relates to the winrate on each account.

replies.body:
We meet again my old friend. 

I can understand how your statistics can seem like they perfectly prove your point but if you take the time to think about it without any bias then you would realise there are other factors in play. I was going through the statistics and your graph for a while since it's quite interesting but I do still believe that you aren't thinking about this in a non-biased manner. You seem to be looking for something to prove you right, rather than prove you wrong which you should strive for.

>Despite this disadvantage of his teammates KDA potential being lower due to supports usual kda ratio, all of his teammates pulled out on average, 36% more kills than they had deaths.
With these teammates he achieved a 100% winrate over 45 games. Despite not performing in every game he still won them all.

There are some important differences to consider. 

Apdo's division was high gold > low plat = teams and enemy higher skill (less deaths avg)

Whitepuma's division was silver I ish

Whitepumah's division was silver IV ish 

Apdo mains MID

The other 2 main ADC

Now his teammates played better than yours did... why? I have answers.

For one he plays mid lane and that is a role that can impact the game more than ADC. He can invade, roam and solo the enemy laner whilst being able to get better vision down (enemy jg camps) support his jungler and generally be more of a menace than an ADC would. There were some jungle games as well but that is arguably the best carry role at least in higher divisions. ADC CAN CARRY but it does become more difficult unless you are very good and creating leads and carrying teamfights which anyone less than diamond would not be able to do well.


The reason why Apdo's team played better than yours is because he helped them. He warded, a lot. He can roam to help all lanes AND jungler and he can provide massive pressure and be able to rely on his godlike decision making to help him in any bad spot he is in (3v1 etc). His most played champion by far is Corki who has insane poke and can roam VERY well especially with things like Package. He would ping a lot and something that you can't do which he does is if he ever gets leads, he doesn't often die. If you are ahead the worst thing you can possibly do is die. You give them some of your massive chunk of EXP and gold. Your KDA's on WhitePuma AND WhitePumah were both less than 3. Frankly that's horrid.

**You can get ALLLLLLLLLLLLLLLL the kills you want but if you feed them back every single game your teams gonna have a fucking hard time.**

Look down your champions, most KDA's are laughable and the ones that aren't are 1-2 games played. Apdo's KDA's are enough to get a hardcore LoL player off tbh. I guarantee you don't ping enough. You die like you were born to do it and you feed back all the kills you get in gold and experience. You don't know when to go to take objectives like Baron, Dragon or even turrets. You don't know HOW and WHEN to lane swap and WHY you do it. You don't know how to itemise or build your champion. You don't know how to carry games and you have the strongest case of the Dunning-Kruger effect I've ever fucking seen and my ex was a shocker let me tell you but damn.

His teams are better because he is better and provides for them. His pinging, csing, warding and knowledge of EVERYTHING incl small things you've probably never thought of like positioning in laning phase and being able to accurately predict the game. He won't let his bot die for free. He won't feed back his 4 level EXP lead and Legendary shut down gold. YOU WOULD. Your KDA's show it. 

Your team has to verse stronger enemies than his team's do because you are fucking terrible at knowing how to control the game and what to do with a lead and you die. YOU LITERALLY AVERAGE 5.0 MORE DEATHS A GAME THAN HIM AND YOU COMPLAIN THAT YOUR TEAM DOES 30% WORSE.

whitepuma having a higher win % than whitepumah even though teams are a bit better is because of 1 of a couple of reasons. You're playing against worse people who can't abuse your shitty positioning and knowledge thus you don't die thus your team has an easier time. You're lucky, yeah, lucky. Win streaks and lose streaks are a thing IF YOU AREN'T SMURFING but I don't know the people you versed in provs with it so I had to add that as an option. You give me a level 30 bronze account and I tryhard on it and my teams will be 50% better than yours or w/e cause I won't die. I will ping and I will set up my team for victory, something you can't do.

As a side note, there were no real games Apdo didn't perform well. Only 2 games were average (by his standard) but he still had great CSPM, lower deaths than you and warded like a season 3 jungler (a lot) + his damage was the highest in the game by far.

Come back to me when you can provide facts, not assumptions.

I put in the effort to provide statistics, and all I ever get met with is being told I am wrong without ever being shown WHY I am wrong.

I am open to being shown exactly how apdo manipulates his teammates into winning their lane without being anywhere near it. I am not simply here looking to complain, I am looking for answers. If you can provide them, then it is up to you whether or not you will take the time to do so.

You're the most ignorant person I've ever met it's unbelievable. The amount of help people try to give you and the shit you answer you don't deserve help. Stop fucking posting on boards. Do you want me to prove my assumptions? Stop being a biased %%%% and watch a vod of him playing and you'll understand. 

You don't want to be proved wrong. You don't want to understand what EVERY good player understands. You just want to think you're right no matter WHO says it or WHAT is said. Faker could explain why you're wrong and you would complete go against what he is said cause he can't prove it to you because the statistics or reasoning isn't good enough, or in other words it isn't coming from you. 

We can't prove it to you if you won't let us. You must have a mental disability to be this thick. I may sound harsh but you're actually fucking painful to try and help. Either realise you're unbelievably biased, ignorant and not willing to learn or just don't post again.

Let me make this clear, YOUR OPINION IS NOT PROOF.

SHOW me, stop fucking typing that I am ignorant and show me EVIDENCE.

I am literally asking to be proven wrong and you tell me I don't want to be proven wrong.

If you do not have evidence then do not bother trying to tell me I am wrong, obviously I am not going to join ISIS just cause they tell me my beliefs are wrong, get your shit sorted.

Provide evidence or don't post again.

If you even think about linking me a vod of him getting the shit helped out of him by his teammates claiming it was a 1v9....

http://puu.sh/vMwyM/b75abac25b.jpg
so i looked at lol skill to see where your twitch was placed and couldnt find you bud, neither of your accounts are even near the top so saying you're the best twitch is a bit of a stretch. Then i go to lolskill to check out your masteries the highest winning masterie besides flash heal is flash ignite with a 65 percent winrate. As a jungle support main id tell you flat out no to taking heal exhaust it has no stats on how it stacks up to the others and i feel for the poor bastard that has to deal with this. You meantioned wanting stats http://puu.sh/vMwTE/b90060cc18.jpg this is the number one twitch in oceana his build is nothing like yours. i dunno man maybe try and reflect on how you can improve :D as for what said above is true mid lane has the most mobility roles can impact the game ina variety of different ways i am only here to say that the way you influence the team is not the same as Apdo he is always challanger his skill is insanely high and he can span it to other games, graphs are incomparable between regions mate we dont have the playerbase or skill level that korea has but if you are fantastic at the game you will climb. it isnt about affecting the randoms they are all people who have god knows what views on how things work and all you can do at that point is encourage and hope your vision, wards and plays pay of mobility and power is what apdo goes for twitch isnt exactly the same as the champs he plays and the way you both play the game is different he has insane game knowledge and insane mechanics which is a trait of his region we have decent enough players but not a big enough playerbase to expand our ability. in short but you can only try your hardest i mean im just an average league player but i think you are going about this the wrong way, if you want peoples respect and attention to what your doing then get super high elo with it, if you cant then it musnt be that great or itd win a higher percentage of games. good luck on the rift summoner

Website: lolskill.net
Ranking: Champion enthusiast
Champion: Twitch
Region: World

Rank 47 last time I checked

You can compare those stats to everyone else. Let me know what you find.

#**Counterpoint:**

Website: oce.op.gg
Ranking: Champion Enthusiast
Champion: Twitch
Region: OCE

Not even on the list, even though it excludes *every other region*. In fact, no one below Diamond 2 is on that list.

**Point being:**
You can't just pick an unofficial source and use that as undeniable proof that you're right, especially when you consider that, firstly, you don't know how lolskill.net (or *most/any* of those types of websites) makes those calculations and, secondly, there are other sources that tell a completely different story.

If you want to prove that you are right, you're going to need more solid "proof" than "lolskill.net says it's true so it must be true". Just saying.

You mean like mathematics?

Tried that, it didn't agree with everyone's opinion so they ignored it.

Maths is data, and data can be skewed by bias just like any scientific evidence. Evidence only has meaning if it shows the whole picture. If it only shows one data point out of 50 that are relevant, then it won't tell you anything, how do you think so many people get tricked by "science" articles. Most believable ones technically don't lie, but they present data from biased or incomplete experiments as fact and fail to present the whole truth, rather only show a part of it.

Just as KDA alone tells you very little about skill. That person could have been carried, they could have got picks on a feeding enemy but not actually killed anyone useful, they might have bitched out of any and all teamfights so never died in one (usually evident in KP). Maybe they had a god tier support and as soon as laning phase ends they're going to feed their ass off.

One stat cannot tell a whole story.

Data can be presented in a bias fashion, but that is why I am asking people to provide their counter point data to challenge my own.

I want to be shown either, the mathematical data that nullifies my own data (it must not conflict with it), or I want to be shown in game how a "booster" deals with scenarios that I am forced into.

I want to be given a free live coaching session so they can literally direct me and tell me what to do so I can see if there is anything I did not know of.

So far the most I have received is a vod review from a rioter who was higher elo than me. The biggest thing he could find for me was not flashing the wall in a teamfight to chase after a low enemy which would not have impacted the game much at all.

But see, that's the thing. Your data ONLY presented KDAs. If someone were to go through and fill out your spreadsheet with data like KP, wards placed, valuable kills vs unimportant kills it would take forever. 

Maybe when I have some time tomorrow I'll see about doing a few games for you, but you're basically telling the community here "I did 1% of the work and I say I'm right, and I'm not going to believe anyone says otherwise unless you random internet strangers do the other 99%". Seems rather unreasonable doesn't it?

If you're so insistent that you want data that contradicts your conclusions if it exists, then why are you not seeking it out yourself? It's easy to prove anything 'right' if you are only looking for data that does exactly that (*cough* a certain American president *cough*), you'll get better, more accurate and more complete conclusions faster if you try instead to prove yourself wrong. That's simply how this kind of research works.

dude, i wouldn't use that for reference if that's the case then the second best twitch is bronze xD.
just go with the skill rating bud being enthusiastic never made anyone the best at anything just means you love it training dedication and ranked so much ranked. Like just having a good kda isn't everything it's more about full game knowledge and knowing how to use yah lead which he obviously does being challenger there is only 200 of them big fish in a small small pond my friend and he is stuck with 199 other amazing players who will slaughter him if he makes one mistep. but i dunno comparing things by the skill rating they obviously have a sick system that works.

The ranking of the champion enthusiast isn't important, on lolskill, "champion enthusiast" is ranked purely on # of games played. On op.gg, "champion enthusiast" is ranked based on # of games played of everyone diamond 2 and above.

The rankings do not determine who is best, but who has played the most of a particular champion. I use this to determine who has played more games, which according to the law of large numbers will bring more accuracy to the stats.

Hence my statement does NOT say, "I am the best twitch." Instead I am saying I have the best stats in the world.

In accordance with everything people have been telling me.

I am supposedly in the rank that I belong. So having the best stats against the rank that I supposedly belong in, should be no different to someone else for example in challenger, having equally as high stats against the rank they supposedly belong in. The only other thing this would mean is that I am the most deserving player to climb out of the rank I am in as I have performed the best relative to my rank in the role that I main.

You should do an update where you analyse the 500~ games you've played this season and determine if it's your horrible build, awful rune setup or perhaps the ridiculousness of forcing your support that you duo 80% of your games with to take Exhaust Heal, leaving them no last resort escape and resulting in them going 1/10 every single game. You've been shit tier elo for the last 4 years, even now you can barely get out of mid gold with over 3500 ranked games played on your account. Perhaps you should abandon these views, as they are quite obviously biased and terribly misguided, go and relearn the game from someone who actually knows how to climb. By the way, it's worth mentioning, a good player with 500 games on your account would be challenger, you're in Gold 4, think about that.

I find it hard to analyze whether or not I am the problem in solo queue due to the fact that out of everyone I have looked up, I have the best stats of all the twitch mains in the world. That includes all those bronze silver and gold players, so you can't be using my rank as an excuse for my overperforming in my rank while telling me I am playing bad as the reason I am not climbing.

Maybe YOU could do the analysis and then post your findings on here. I would be interested to see your results.

> [{quoted}](name=whitePumah,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=liHY5B94,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2017-05-10T11:33:32.192+0000)

That includes all those bronze silver and gold players, so you can't be using my rank as an excuse for my overperforming in my rank while telling me I am playing bad as the reason I am not climbing.
> 
> Maybe YOU could do the analysis and then post your findings on here. I would be interested to see your results.

Are you actually fucking insane? What kind of ridiculous statement is that?
you die like 6-7 times a game, the ones you lose you are hard feeding. I don't know who you looked up, but I know people in silver that shit on you in lane. The best stats of any twitch main in the world, is that relevant to mastery score because that's just how many games you grind out. If you're talking about your stats, you aren't even listed if you're below diamond on most reputable sites. Also, congratulations to the guy above you, climbing out of bronze is a big deal. Remember to always look at the bigger picture and ignore everything this guy says, as he is the exact opposite of an analyst, coach, whatever he claims to be these days. Btw, every game you play is against low gold/high silver and your mmr is actually garbage. There are boosters in Diamond 5 who could do what you have attempted in 60 games. There are professionals currently with like 90% win rates on the Brazil server right now in preparations for MSI. They got those win rates because they play every game as well as it possibly could be, and if they don't, they know how it could have been done better. You have stagnated in Gold because you can't learn anything that you don't already tell yourself because of your insane bias.

> [{quoted}](name=Huskey,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=liHY5B94,comment-id=000400000000,timestamp=2017-05-11T08:22:13.730+0000)
> Btw, every game you play is against low gold/high silver and your mmr is actually garbage. 



> [{quoted}](name=whitePumah,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=liHY5B94,comment-id=00040000,timestamp=2017-05-10T11:33:32.192+0000)
 so you can't be using my rank as an excuse for my overperforming in my rank while telling me I am playing bad as the reason I am not climbing.


You need to go to champion enthusiasts, and then you will find me on the second page. Compare my stats to every other twitch main you can find and find me someone with over 100 games who has better overall stats. (stats do not include winrate due to the external factors out of the players control.)

Even if we include your flex queue games, which I don't think we should. Your average this season on twitch is 14.6/6/5 with 213.9 cs. Judging from your match history this is being seriously inflated by your flex queue games. The only two ranked solo games I can see you were 8/4/5.5 on average. 

Your stats are pretty good on twitch. But as far as adcs go there not even better than the top adcs in Oce, yet alone the world. 

You have some good stats on twitch but that doesn't garuntee climbing up the rankings. Quite frankly I think, you think your better than you are. Meaning your blaming others for all of your problems. Do you honestly think you can keep the same kind of stats up when you start vsing better players. I'm going to go with no.

Edit: These stats were on your whitepumah account. The ones on whitepuma were even worse

The whitepuma account doesnt have many games at all.

I just quickly checked through every adc main in the top 30 of each champion and none of them even come close to my stats. Even the dravens that should have more gold on average per game due to kill passive.

Literally nothing guarantees climbing up the ranks.

Being good at any one thing does not guarantee climbing, that is true. But you're narrowing your view to one or two things, instead of considering the whole picture. 
Good K/D/A won't get you very far if you have trash tier (read, me tier) CS and therefore are lacking in income compared to your enemy. 
CS doesn't mean anything if you aren't using the gold to help your team. 
Helping your team doesn't mean anything if you are also helping (read feeding) the enemy team.
Being strong as an ADC (KDA/Gold) doesn't mean much if you have no vision/vision control/map awareness and get caught out at turning points.
Having lots of kills means nothing if all those kills are on low priority targets that don't mean much in fights.

If your KDA is good for your rank, then that isn't what you should be working on to climb out of that rank. If your CS is good for your rank it's not what you should be working on and visa versa and so on and so forth. You shouldn't be worrying about what you are doing better than others of your rank, but rather what you are doing worse than them. From a brief skim, looks like teamwork, teamfight mechanics (focus/positioning/priorites) and likely vision/map awareness are the things you need to be working on, not your overall KDA.

Increasing KDA does not mean increasing skill, it means increasing one aspect of skill. If you are good at one thing, but fall short on a bunch of others, you're destroying any advantage you have and therefore will remain where you are.

> [{quoted}](name=Seras Dragon,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=liHY5B94,comment-id=0004000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2017-05-13T13:22:02.551+0000)
> 
> If your KDA is good for your rank, then that isn't what you should be working on to climb out of that rank. If your CS is good for your rank it's not what you should be working on and visa versa and so on and so forth. You shouldn't be worrying about what you are doing better than others of your rank, but rather what you are doing worse than them. From a brief skim, looks like teamwork, teamfight mechanics (focus/positioning/priorites) and likely vision/map awareness are the things you need to be working on, not your overall KDA.

What data are you using to reach this conclusion?

From a brief skim (of your Twitch games), meaning I didn't look all that deep, just looked at what stats (or skills indicated by those stats) could be imporved. 

Teamwork was mostly based on your interactions here, since trying to force your will onto others in game never ends well for anyone, you'd be better off presenting things as requests, gets you a lot further, but that's only an assumption. Some people interact very differently on boards to what they do in game and only you can answer that one.

Teamfight mechanics was because you have as you say, good KDAs and generally good KP so why is your team still losing if the ADC is doing so much work? Some games ofc there are just too many odds stacked against you, but that's not every game so where is the problem? Usually if this is the case the problem lies in objective control and teamfight priorities. It's all well and good for you to kill four of them and then die, but if the one you leave alive can then ace your team, it doesn't really work in your favour. Ofc ADC only has so much control over this, but even just your life or death can have a massive impact on a game, and some deaths can mean a lost game. Without watching your replays, I don't know how much of this is relevant.

Vision and map awareness are probably the biggest things that people insist they are good at, and hate on people for being bad at, but often gets lost at points of the game, especially fights. Doesn't matter how good your map awareness CAN be if it isn't consistent. You have to remember that even in fights you have to be aware of your surroundings, and vision this is obviously key to knowing that. I don't think there's ever a game when someone couldn't have done map awareness better, no matter how high you go.

> I understand that KDA does not equal the result of each game, but based on these statistics, it paints a pretty clear picture as to how KDA of 80% of the team directly relates to the winrate on each account.

You know that Apdo probably had something to do with his teammates' KDA, right?
Just compare your KDA to his, you'll notice a huge difference.

> [{quoted}](name=Aegis EnGarde,realm=NA,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=liHY5B94,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-01-25T23:25:04.275+0000)
>
> You know that Apdo probably had something to do with his teammates' KDA, right?
> Just compare your KDA to his, you'll notice a huge difference.

What about his teammates having something to do with his KDA?

Especially since there is 4 of them and only 1 of him, it would make more sense that they impact his KDA more than he impacts theirs.

Everyone seems to have a rather biased outlook on this instead of looking at every factor. They only focus on the factors they want to, I focus on all factors and how they interact, If I am missing factors let me know and I will input them into the equation.

> Everyone seems to have a rather biased outlook on this instead of looking at every factor. They only focus on the factors they want to, I focus on all factors and how they interact, If I am missing factors let me know and I will input them into the equation.

I don't know what your point is when you say "all factors", when you clearly forgot to put yourself into the equation. If you think a challenger cannot do well with a smurf account, I think you have some problem in your logic.

By the way, if you're using normal games for your "data", don't you think you are quite biased yourself?

All this information I have is specifically Ranked solo.

I think that when a challenger players get consistently bad teams, they will struggle just as much as any other player does.

I played another game on my smurf, good teammates, didnt even have to try, 73% winrate.

So with my average teammates about 10% above average, I now have a 73% winrate, compared to my main account which has a 44% winrate, I play exactly the same and yet I have a 29% difference in winrate.

> All this information I have is specifically Ranked solo.

Then hey, congratulations, you just successfully whipped out data for 40 games when you only have 11 ranked games on your whitepuma account.

Now that I check your spreadsheet, I don't think I can correspond the data I got and calculated from the official match history website and op.gg to yours. Are you gonna tell me now that the games you recorded are probably months old?

To be honest, I have no idea why I even bothered, you are just another salty silver player who can't climb but somehow wants to find an excuse as to why you cannot, and with too much time on your hand, you decided to write up a spreadsheet about how you got dealt crappy players.

The point of my comment is to argue against your logic and discredit your "proof", so other players don't circlejerk about it.

> [{quoted}](name=Aegis EnGarde,realm=NA,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=liHY5B94,comment-id=00000000000100000001,timestamp=2017-01-26T04:21:49.381+0000)
>
> Then hey, congratulations, you just successfully whipped out data for 40 games when you only have 11 ranked games on your whitepuma account.
> 
> The point of my comment is to argue against your logic and discredit your "proof", so other players don't circlejerk about it.

I thought I made it clear that I had 2 accounts?

whitepuma - http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=whitepuma

whitepumah - http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=whitepumah

Apdo - http://www.op.gg/summoner/userName=Skevvecl

What part are you missing?

The statistics are all there, you can check it for yourself.

No data was whipped out of thin air and no data was taken from normals.

This is purely the random teammates that are given to each player in each game.

I think what he means is that with proper team co-ordination (ya know, the type that comes from having an innately better player on your team), players are going to perform better. 

For example: I have been watching my friends stream regularly this week. She always plays in a 5man and they usually do average/below average because that's just how they are. Suddenly, we replace on of them with a challenger player, and even in the games where he's doing crap the game is still a win and everyone comes off with a better KDA.

Why?

Because he has enough macro and micro play to direct the team to a win, even if he isn't obviously carrying. Players like this don't even have to use voice coms to get their point across, it's just something they are able to do because they have developed this skill through various means. 

**
In terms of experimentation and "evidence", a 10 game period is not nearly enough to show statistical significance in your data. The most commonly accepted "settle period" when it comes to LoL win rates, KDAs and ranks is 100 games. Continue playing till you hit this milestone then present your case. I believe you will find your smurf stats similar to your main stats. **

But your team has to co-ordinate WITH YOU as well, it is not simply he puts down wards and pings that enemies are coming and where they are heading and bam 100% win rate.

His team still has to react to this information correctly, he cannot react to it for them, it is 100% up to them how they proceed with the given information.

I will however play 100 games on my smurf, and if the 11 ranked solo games were any evidence of what is to come from the average of my teammates. Then theoretically I should be in platinum in under 100 games.

Also if you know you have a challenger player on your team for example as a lower elo player you are going to take less risks cause you expect them to stomp lane, thus being in a position to capitalise on the enemies mistakes more often and less deaths means it is easier for the players who are not fed to make an impact.

Aegis has a point, though.

You said yourself that "he [Apdo] is known as a solo queue god because of his insane win rates and high performances." If he's that good, then logically he would have quite a significant impact on his teams in low ELO, where players are (generally) a lot less skilled and much more prone to mistakes and have a lack of knowledge and mechanical ability. It would seem reasonable that someone like that (higher ELO/skill) would have a far greater impact on their teammates than someone of our (lower/mid ELO/skill) abilities.

One big flaw:
Apdo does well, influencing other lanes. His kills/assists affects his teams' kills/assists, raising the KDA of his teammates.

It should be mentioned champion enthusiasts applies to people with high mastery points on their champ, some of the less popular champions have people in bronze and silver listed quite high on the rankings. You seriously can not be arguing that you're among the best players in the world at your role, while being hard stuck in Gold. You actually have Silver MMR so if you lose more and drop to Gold 5, there's a serious possibility that you'll be demoted to SIlver. How can one of the best players in the world be hardstuck in the depths of Elo hell? There's multiple unranked to challenger/master/diamond streams where they get to their goal rank in 24 hours. It's taken you 5 months to get to Gold 4 and those people aren't even close to being the best in the world. Examples would be people like Gosu (notoriously incosistent high elo adc main, got Diamond 5 in 21 hours from level 30 unranked, while streaming). You get your best champion almost every game, build an entire composition around yourself and you still barely win 50% of your games. You'll likely never make it to Platinum with your current playstyle/mindset, something that would be really easy to change for the sake of actually being able to show you're good at the game.
Yep, you are right.

It would be interesting to see the statistics of the smurf account after 100 games. Last year in dynamic queue I finished in silver 5 at the end of the season. This season in flex I was placed in bronze 5 and now I've played more than 100 games so far and am in bronze 4. Is this because the server cannot handle 2 queues at the same time?
I still think at each end of the elo (mmr) spectrum there are many abnormalities. For example for matchmaking in flex queue, you'll see one team have a bunch of (soloqueue ranked) bronzers and another have a bunch of soloqueue ranked bronzers with the odd gold thrown in. Flex queue possibly does not take into account soloqueue rank, and so newbies to flex that are gold in soloqueue but got placed lowly in flex queue will still be paired with bronze veterans. Which creates quite an imbalance in the game.
Being a support main, it's quite hard to climb under these conditions, no matter how much I type, ping, and instruct the team. Bronze rarely listen.

Seems like Huskey above has opened this old chestnut. Does the OP have any updates on their statistics?

For me I've played a further 100 games in flex queue and I'm now at Silver 5. For soloqueue, I started later in the season to avoid the patzers and after about 100 games I'm also at Silver 5. What was interesting is that a couple of weeks ago, a Diamond smurf (yes, they are diamond) was surprised with my op.gg stats and how I could still be in bronze (at the time). I guess it's because the **relevant** statistics are not on display.
